1.3.2_paragraph1: A well-written Will can definitely speed up the finalization of your estate and reduce administration costs.
1.3.4_paragraph1: If you are single and still have parents to care for.
1.3.6_paragraph1: If you are single and still have parents to care for.
1.3.8_paragraph1: You can now appoint someone to manage your wealth who ensures your beneficiaries receive their inheritance according to your final wish.
1.3.10_paragraph1: You can now specify ‘who’ to receive your wealth and ‘how’ to transfer it to your beneficiaries of your own choice and preference.
1.3.12_paragraph1: You can now name the legal guardians for your minor children if both you and your spouse are no longer around.
1.3.14_paragraph1: If you would like to bequeath money to charities, you may decide what type of bequest you would like to give to your chosen charity.
